Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: amyyy93
Reviews.Content: Great location, first impressions of rooms good, but on closer inspection a few minor flaws. Beds were very comfortable and shower was good, but very hot. Slight lack of soundproofing. The breakfast was simple but still better than some that we have encountered at other hotels. Overall brilliant location.

Reviews.Title: “Give this a miss”
Reviews.Author: Sopa_K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at 27 Paddington for 3 nights last July during a trip with friends. Even though we booked two twin rooms we arrived there to find out that in this hotel only double rooms are available (not a good start I thought). Before checking in we were asked to pay the whole amount of money for our stay upfront which was ok but kind of strange. The hotel is actually two separate buildings with different entrance. Our rooms were not in the main building so we had to go out to Craven Road (a quite busy avenue) and then enter the main builiding everytime we wanted to visit the reception table or have breakfast. Breakfast itself was disappointing but after what we had already seen we weren't surprised. Rather poor, limited choices, we eventually gave it a miss and went out for breakfast. The worst aspect of this hotel though is the rooms. It was the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in. We could barely open our baggage. Bathroom was equally small and uncomfortable. There was also a small, dirty (full of dust and cigarretes) balcony. It was hazardous to be out there cause if you miss your step it is likely that you' ll be diving down the road. Therefore rooms are absolutely not suitable for children. Now as for cleanliness, what a surprise: rooms were not clean! Stains of dirt on the sheets and towels, hair in the bathroom, cigarretes all over the balcony. Medium size plasma tv couldn't make up for this. Overall it looked like a cheap hotel except it was not actually that cheap. The only good aspect is the location, which was originally the reason we booked. Its in Paddington, withing walking distance from Paddington railway and tube station, not far away from all the main attractions of central London. I'm sure though that there are other better options at the same price if you are looking to stay around Paddington area, so just avoid this place, it's not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special to complain about”
Reviews.Author: slovene
Reviews.Content: -good location -rooms recently renovated, very clean and quiet (on courtyard side), just a bit tiny. Regarding internet pictures, some rooms seem to be much bigger than ours.... -decent breakfast -hotel staff friendly and very helpful. (I forgot my mobile in the bedside drawer on the last day and after phoning to the hotel a cooperative lady at the reception took care of it and return it to me properly)

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, clean, and family-run”
Reviews.Author: NaderH
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for only one night after desperately looking for a hotel 10 hours before arrival. The hotel turned out to be really good with a walking distance of 10 minutes from the Paddington underground station. It was a bit expensive but not too much (90 GBP per night) The hotel had no elevator, but offered the following for free: - breakfast - Wifi - TV - Hair dryer - Tea Kettle The staff are extremely friendly, and the location is kind of nice, just above the street. One problem arose which was that the tea kettle was still dirty from previous users. I recommend it by 60%

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lacking other conveniences”
Reviews.Author: Laura C
Reviews.Content: Positives are cleanliness, free wifi and convenient location. On the negative side rooms are not to a great standard with regards fixtures and fittings. Nice flat screen tv but not tuned in, two shower heads but one didn't have a bracket, mattress on double needs turning or replacing as it had two people-shaped dips in it. If something is broken it seems to be left or repair botched. Little things that you don't tend to see at a quality hotel. There is no lift and a narrow staircase to rooms, not great if you have more than one small bag. Also a noisy hotel, you can hear traffic and people outside, as well as other people in their rooms. This hotel is fine for those looking for a crash pad in a decent location that is a little cheaper than some of the chain hotels, but not a relaxing getaway, family trip or business travel location.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Novello
Reviews.Content: Really, the only thing that this hotel has going for it is its central location. The bus stops and underground are only 5 minutes away; lots of restaurants very close to the hotel. Bedroom was a decent size, once you got to it, which we shared with some tiny ants! Bathroom was fine but small. First night we were at the front of the hotel, VERY noisy from the street (despite requesting a "quiet room" in my original booking). We were changed on day 2 to the back, which was quiet. The entrance and reception are to say the least very basic, to the point of being off-putting. Basic is the by-word of the hotel. We had a double room in the adjacent, unconnected building. We were on the third floor, up 54 steep narrow stairs - no lift! No drawer space to unpack - we decided not to bother; tiny wardrobe, with only 2 hangers - 1 each. No sign anywhere of the "stylish decor" mentioned in the website. Breakfast was very basic. The staff were very friendly, and reactive, when asked, rather than any suggestion of using their initiative. Internet kept going down. Frankly the 3 star rating of this hotel is a joke; at 105 GB pounds a night it was a rip off! Apart from the disappointment with the hotel, we enjoyed our time in wonderful London

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: clea2003
Reviews.Content: We just wanted a twin room near Paddington as we were going to a concert in London. This hotel had very pleasant and friendly reception staff, and the room was clean and fairly quiet. We were allowed to leave our luggage with reception on day of check out, and unlike some hotels the reception door was locked when there was nobody available even for a few minutes, which is reassuring. On the downside there was some noise from the air conditioner which seemed to be right outside, and because the entire hotel decided 9am was the ideal time for breakfast the staff struggled a little - not something that was a major problem though. I certainly wouldn't mark either of these minor negatives as a reason not to book it again.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING! DO NOT BOOK SINGLE ROOM A03 IN THE BASEMENT!”
Reviews.Author: flocke71
Reviews.Content: in front of the window are two air conditions placed. the mattress is worn. instead of a lath floor a wood! shaky bathroom fittings, lot of dust and dirt behind the bed, clammy spots with first fungi on it directly beneath the bed! rusty water boiler. under the bed a toxic mousetrap! "highlight": the room door stood one evening open, the room maid forgot to close the bar! breakfast is very reduced and simple. the "hotel" seems more to be a high-priced youth hostel! the hotel should improve their customer relation management in critical situations! positive: the location very near to Paddington station.

Reviews.Title: “The family room was clean and ok .”
Reviews.Author: ang016
Reviews.Content: The family room was clean and ok for an overnight stay. Room was on the 3rd floor and was hard work . I would not call this a hotel but a b&b , there was no signal for the tv, no welcome book that you would normally receive from a hotel. We were given a piece of paper with instuction. But overall the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “nice to come again”
Reviews.Author: bleem
Reviews.Content: i came here for honeymoon which i stayed 3 nights here , in a basement room at next block : - clean and tidy and new - king sized double bed - friger , warmer , water boiler in room - quiet at night - free wi-fi!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Wang75
Reviews.Content: Clean room with modern decoration. The bathroom is rather small but ok for use. Location is good, very close to Metro and Paddington station. Our room is on the street side, it's noisy during morning and evening. I think the hotel is good, but not for the people who wants to experince the British culture, it's just a nice room to stay with.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly but room a little on small side”
Reviews.Author: CMI28
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very bright and fresh having recently been done out and the staff were polite and friendly. The room was in the basement, it was pretty small no where to put suitcases so I had mine near my bed which was a bit annoying and the other underneath a table beside the bed otherwise we wouldn't of been able to walk around the room. The room was very clean and bright with modern decor and it had coffee and tea making facilities , there was a small cupboard for putting clothes in and this also housed a small fridge which came in handy. The bathroom was lovely with a massive shower the only problem we could see was that if you had somebody who was a little on the large side they might struggle to get through the sliding door to the shower as it only opened so far so it would be a bit of a squeeze. The bed was comfy and clean and the wall opposite had a small flat screen T.V. The problem with the room being in the basement was you could sometimes hear the underground trains and banging from chairs and feet as our room seemed to be somewhere underneath the breakfast and reception area - this was annoying because it meant you could hear people coming and going at all hours. Overall this was a nice Hotel which I would go back to, but I would make sure not to get a basement room.

Reviews.Title: “better than a 4 star down the road”
Reviews.Author: jk2308
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, everything is brand new, not even 2 minutes from paddington station. Staff very helpful (especially the Indian guy on night shifts...). We stayed before in Best western which is down the road from 27 paddington. we liked this one much more. closer to the tube, much nicer and brighter room (about the same size), more personal service... Breakfast simple, but everything you need - toast, croissant, ham, cheese, jams, fruits, yoghurts, cereals and to my surprise, when I asked for coffee I got double espresso. That's a huge plus (best western had only filtered coffee...)

HotelInfo.Name: 27 Paddington
HotelInfo.Address: 25-27 Craven Road, London W2 3BU, England
